page.title: 12WAKEFIELD GIRLS HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Founded in 1878 by the governors of Wakefield Charities this former direct grant school became independent in 1975. It has 880 pupils from 4-18 coming from up to 35 miles away. Wentworth House where the school began remains the centre of school life but much new building has equipped the school for modern needs. The school has a strong sense of community and offers a broadly based education leading to O and A level examinations. Extra curricular activities provide for most interests. Girls join in sports and musical activities with other Wakefield pupils. Most leavers from the sixth form of 180 go on to higher education. Former pupils work in oil production nuclear engineering and television presentation. The school continues to adapt to meet the needs of each generation. Y.F.HAND
